website_summaries.verdict: An ideal study guide for self-motivated students, created by a well-respected expert in the LSAT community. Fun and easy read.
pros: Over 200 actual LSAT questions are included
Emphasis is on test taking strategies
30 drills to improve critical and logical thinking skills
Author is an LSAT teacher and test developer
cons: Formatting can be confusing, text contains grammatical errors
Lacks good preparation for Logic Games test section

customer_reviews.title: Thanks Mike Kim
customer_reviews.text: I got a 174. This book really teaches you to understand the LSAT, and it’s written in a fun and engaging style that makes studying less painful. Excersizes are consistently helpful. Consider using in combination with the Powerscore Bible and/or 7Sage videos if your weakness is logic games like me.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: If you're going to self-study, buy this book.
customer_reviews.text: If you're self-studying, do yourself a favor and get this book. I know there are so many books available and it can feel overwhelming to choose, but one look at Mike Kim's website and reviews should tell you that this guy is the real deal. I read it cover to cover, completed every exercise, and got in the 94th percentile of the LSAT.
customer_reviews.author: Jackie F.

customer_reviews.title: Best LSAT prep out there
customer_reviews.text: I seriously regret ever taking the Kaplan course for $1000. This book has it all with so much clarity. Mike Kim does a great job keeping things candid and simple. Book is worth every penny, and if you spend a month and a half doing every page thoroughly it is basically impossible to not improve. I was stuck in the 160 range when I started, but know now I am able to score consistently around 170. So pleased with this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Tunariffic

customer_reviews.title: This Book Is Better Than The Bibles
customer_reviews.text: I should have bought this book first. Basically all the Powersource books into one.
customer_reviews.author: MaryAnn

customer_reviews.title: Nontraditional Student- Very Helpful!
customer_reviews.text: I am a single mother and a nontraditional law student who is going to law school to become a disability rights lawyer because I want to help others who are going through similar challenges to the ones my family has faced. I used the LSAT Trainer while being a mommy, working full-time, and working on my MEd. I took the LSAT in January, and I've already been accepted into 2 law schools! This is a great book! :)
customer_reviews.author: Book Buyer

customer_reviews.title: Some of the reviews here & on other forums were ...
customer_reviews.text: Some of the reviews here & on other forums were frustratingly vague. Sometimes a simple "buy this book. trust me." I wanted more details from everyone! Now I see why. Buy this book. Trust. Me. It fills gaps and missing links that leads to phenomenal score increases.
customer_reviews.author: PrimeAddict

customer_reviews.title: The LSAT Trainer: A Beautiful Bible
customer_reviews.text: Perhaps the best trainer on the market. Mike Kim's wonderful methodology helped me not only understand the intricacies of the LSAT better, but also overcome my test-taking blocks. To top it off, Mike is a fully-engaged mentor who clearly cares about his work--you can reach out to him through the LSAT Trainer forums or via email and receive top-notch advice. The LSAT Trainer also has an incredible schedule break-down to help even the busiest working professionals make time for practicing, studying, and creating healthy habits. Huge fan and highly recommended for independent learners.
customer_reviews.author: B. Robinson

customer_reviews.title: BUUUUUYYYYYY IIIIITTTTTTTTT
customer_reviews.text: Sooooooooo helpful Get this book, definitely worth the money Fyi, buy a normal test book as well to help to practice. this has some great exercises, but you will need a test book (the ones with the 10 actual last exams) to really get the most.
customer_reviews.author: lydia buckmire

customer_reviews.title: This book will increase your score
customer_reviews.text: I decided very last minute to apply to law school. I registered for the LSAT and had 8 weeks to get ready. On my initial practice exam I got a 153. I followed the 8 week study guide on the website, finished all the lessons in the book, and bought extra practice exams to get extra practice in the last 2 weeks. I ended up with a 165 and got into law school. I only did self study with this book, and I felt bad for the kids who spent hundreds or even thousands on tutors and courses.
customer_reviews.author: PhillyMommy

customer_reviews.title: WARNING: PAGES MAY BE CUT OFF
customer_reviews.text: I gave this prep book a 1/5 because of the pages being cut off, not for the actual content.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Incredible Self Study LSAT Book
customer_reviews.text: I loved this book. It was the only LSAT study book I used and I increased my score 11 points (to a 174). You have to be dedicated to studying every week, following the online study schedule they provide, and take the recommended practice tests. It was a huge commitment but definitely worth it. I initially tried out other popular (and more expensive) books but this was the best for me (and best price!). I did not use a tutor or a class but saw incredible results. I recommend this book to everyone. Thank you!!
customer_reviews.author: Killian

customer_reviews.title: Well designed!
customer_reviews.text: This book obviously has been designed with careful thought and logical outlining both in writing and aesthetic. I believe book design can add to the material or seriously detract. The material, for the self-directed student, is easy to understand while not getting bogged down in minutiae. The design and layout of the book is conducive to personal note taking in large margins as well as provides attractive and understandable illustrations for various aspects of LSAT prep. 10/10 would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph A. D'Angelo

customer_reviews.title: Not the best with Logic Games, Great with everything else
customer_reviews.text: The LSAT Trainer is a book I flew through in a few weeks. It's a hefty book, about 600 pages. The book talks to you on a very understanding and personable level. It repeats things over and over again so the concepts become habitual in your brain. The only thing it is weak in is the logic games, but everything else is great. I would recommend, its worth the money especially compared to alternative studying materials.
customer_reviews.author: joey

customer_reviews.title: Useless Book is incorrect
customer_reviews.text: Throughout the book you will find wrong examples and incorrect answers. You will try to do an example you will solve it and then when you check your answers you will be wrong not because of any mistakes you did but because the idiot who wrote the example put two answer which are equally true. Save ur self the money DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I have been reading the material and it is very ...
customer_reviews.text: I have been reading the material and it is very helpful. Instead of you memorizing different types of questions and terminology of test concept, it helps you to understand the logic of test writers.
customer_reviews.author: Hanna Lee

customer_reviews.title: Great for self study
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been self studying for the LSAT for October 2020. I bought this after many great reviews. I find it easy to understand. This book has helped tremendously on the logic games which I struggle with. I used the study guide ans schedule provided online. I love the drills at the end of each chapter. I also found some YouTube videos from the author that I’ve incorporated in my studies. Only time will tell
customer_reviews.author: WeyGray

customer_reviews.title: Great study guide and helped me score in the 170s
customer_reviews.text: I'd highly recommend this book to anyone not wanting to pay a crazy sum of money to a tutor. Get this book and go to the LSAT Trainer website and follow one of the study schedules (I followed the 16 week schedule). My abilities drastically improved by following this book and study guide, I was scoring consistently in the 170s on my final practice exams and scores in the 170s on the actual LSAT because of this book. My only caveat is that you need to be disciplined and follow the study guide religiously.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Trabold

customer_reviews.title: Great LSAT prep book
customer_reviews.text: I loved this book, read every page and did all the exercises, it did help. However I also did 20+ LSAT preptests and when I missed problems I went back over it and tried again and that helped my score more than anything. Rock on.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Higgins

customer_reviews.title: Not sure why there are so many good reviews.
customer_reviews.text: Not that easy to follow. Gives a few concepts and then says if you don’t feel comfortable to practice the same excercises over and over. Not really helpful. There’s better options. Too bad I can’t return it.
customer_reviews.author: The Guy

customer_reviews.title: The LSAT Trainer is superior. Before I got far into it (I think ...
customer_reviews.text: I have looked at other LSAT books. The LSAT Trainer is superior. Before I got far into it (I think lesson three), I came across an invaluable skill: dual diagramming. Other LSAT books didn't even mention that technique. There are countless other positive things I could say about the Trainer. But for the purpose of being brief, I would like to add one more thing to this review. I emailed Mr. Kim a question. He took the time to read it, understand it, and reply in very thoughtful way. His response addressed my questions perfectly. That kind of personal touch goes a long way with me. It speaks volumes about Mr. Kim.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Lowenthal

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for RC
customer_reviews.text: I got this book to supplement my RC studying. My score went from -12 to -4 after spending 8+ hours going through all of the RC material. I have yet to read the rest, but the RC help alone was worth the purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: The best LSAT prep starter guide
customer_reviews.text: I started with LSAT for Dummies but should have bought the Trainer instead. I improved from 157 to 165 with this book and used section-specific guides to improve from there. This all-in-one starter is an ideal way to begin self-study since it helps to build solid habits from the outset. All you need to self-prep is the Trainer, section specific supplements like the Powerscore Bibles, and plenty of real practice exams.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Good price - better book
customer_reviews.text: I can finally post my review. Thank you Mike for this wonderful book. I was able to reach my LSAT goals and am attending a great law school in two weeks.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Don't bother with this book
customer_reviews.text: I was using this book to self-study for the March 2019 LSAT. I had studied this book for nearly two months. Then I enrolled with Kaplan, where they give you the newest LSAT Unlocked book. If all you do is purchase a book for self-study, then purchase the Kaplan LSAT Unlocked text. Hands down, the methods are better explained; more details; and proven methods to boost your score! I have seen serious gains using the Kaplan method. Studying the LSAT takes discipline and is trying enough, make it easier on yourself with Kaplan!
customer_reviews.author: Clint Roberts

customer_reviews.title: Huge resource for the serious candidate!
customer_reviews.text: This guide has a wealth of helpful content and exercises to improve your LSAT score. The title means just that -- Trainer -- so leave yourself time to digest the material and practice through it. I recommend delving into this guide at least a couple of months before your test date to really capture and retain everything. The explanations are easy to understand and implement, but you need time to complete it all. Besides actual prior tests, this is your essential LSAT prep resource.
customer_reviews.author: Greenwood

customer_reviews.title: Most helpful book....
customer_reviews.text: I spent significant money on two prep courses and none answered my basic questions about the LSAT which for me was key understanding the test. This book from beginning answered it. As I continue reading this book, so far it has been more helpful than both prep courses. Will this translate to an improved score on the LSAT? Maybe or maybe not but I'm confident if I (or anyone) applies themselves that it will definitely result in a better/decent score. Also, be sure to check out his website for additional information.
customer_reviews.author: dallen

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money.
customer_reviews.text: Terrible. Explanations are the worse possible. Do not waste money on this book.
customer_reviews.author: JOHANNA

customer_reviews.title: A truly remarkable self-study guide
customer_reviews.text: Leading up to the September 2017 LSAT, I used this book religiously for three months to self-study. Not only does Mike Kim make it easy to learn, he makes it fun. There are awesome timing strategies in the book, and he really focuses on teaching you the skills you need to succeed and be able to tackle any question type thrown your way. I highly recommend this book in conjunction with the LSAT prep tests to study for the LSAT.
customer_reviews.author: PeggyH

customer_reviews.title: Get this book!
customer_reviews.text: This is THE book to get for those who aim to score 160+. Used in addition with 7sage, you can’t find a better or more affordable way to prepare for the LSAT! Thank you Mike Kim!
customer_reviews.author: Tyler the beagador

customer_reviews.title: This is by far the best one out there and teaches you how to best ...
customer_reviews.text: Wow. If you are studying on your own, get this book. This is by far the best one out there and teaches you how to best prepare for the test rather than show what's going to be on the test and have you mimick it back. Mike Kim goes over fundamentals that will teach you in the simplest ways how to solve each section of the LSAT. I was nervous before I started studying with this book and now I feel much more confident.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Terrible, unacceptable binding quality
customer_reviews.text: The binding on this book is terrible. On the first open, the first pages came out without even bending back the cover. I’m 68 pages in and each time I go to open up the book, nothing extreme (no rolling back behind), just read and working in a book, the pages come out. Perhaps the content is good, but if you don’t want to deal with the mess, I recommend finding a different resource.
customer_reviews.author: 9femme

customer_reviews.title: Useless book, Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: some of the pages began to come off the first time I used the book. After comparing with power score bible, this is a useless book. The author is really bad at explaining stuff. He simply gives the reason:” this answe does not look right.” This dude, Mike KIM, it seems like he has never learnt formal logic before. He makes a very simple logical relapse confusing! The power score bible makes things much clearer! Do not buy it! What a waste of money!
customer_reviews.author: User

customer_reviews.title: helps concepts make sense in a new way
customer_reviews.text: Other study books tend to have overly complicated steps they tell you that you must follow in order to solve problems and formulas you must memorize to answer questions. This book helps you to understand the goal of each question and to think for yourself.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The best single volume LSAT book, period.
customer_reviews.text: I'm a former attorney full-time LSAT teacher/tutor/writer/curriculum developer. I scored in the 99th percentile on the LSAT, and I know much more about the test now than I did when I took it. I own most of the commercially available test prep materials, and I've seen the written materials that the major test prep companies provide to their students, because most of the people who contact me for LSAT tutoring have taken a course previously. I can say without reservation that The LSAT Trainer by Mike Kim is the best single volume on the LSAT that I've come across, and I've come across almost all of them. I recommend it to all of my students.
customer_reviews.author: Dan F. Oakes

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME LSAT STUDY BOOK
customer_reviews.text: I love how Mike Kim speaks in this book. You feel like you have a personal study partner that's helping you along the way. The book is very easy to understand and follow. Great ideas and tips about the LSAT. If you are truly serious about taking the LSAT then I suggest this book. Also, if it matters. This book is very appealing to the eye. Great cover art and texture.
customer_reviews.author: Todd

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful but missing pages (2ndEdition)
customer_reviews.text: I’m enjoying this book. The lessons learnt surely go beyond the scope of law. There are some missing pages in the chapter 9/10 area, and as such, I deduct a star.
customer_reviews.author: Darwin, Charles Darwin

customer_reviews.title: I'm also in a paid course ($1000+) which is useful for forced exposure as well as endurance practice
customer_reviews.text: I am currently studying for the LSAT. I purchased this book after buying similar (cheaper) LSAT books and finding myself dissatisfied. I'm also in a paid course ($1000+) which is useful for forced exposure as well as endurance practice, but when I study on my own I bypass all the class materials and pick this book up. In contrast to the class I can feel my abilities being honed after each section. I can't recommend this book highly enough.
customer_reviews.author: EGDR

customer_reviews.title: Well written!
customer_reviews.text: Book was in perfect condition. I'm on lesson 4 and I LOVE the teaching style. I will update this review after I take my first actual LSAT with my score. I admit I didn't care to leave it bound. I cut it apart and 3 hole punched it to make it more useable (easy project). The author has a confident, straightforward, easy to read writing style.
customer_reviews.author: Claudette L.

customer_reviews.title: Must buy for the LSAT
customer_reviews.text: In my opinion this is the best book to buy for the logical reasoning section. Unlike traditional LSAT books, the Trainer actually provides you with a single methodology that makes it easier to breeze through the LR section. I would also recommend buying the Logical Reasoning Bible too though because there are some essential tips in there that the Trainer doesn't go into much depth on. But overall I would say this book is the best.
customer_reviews.author: Aegon

customer_reviews.title: A great start to your LSAT training.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve utilized at least three LSAT training books, prep LSAT tests, and prep courses. Although each of those were useful and had their specific applications, this book has worked the best for me. It allows the opportunity to work through problems at my own pace, the material is presented in an understandable manner, and it covers great content with corresponding questions/answers for each section. Since I started working on this trainer, my score has gone up 5-10 points and has increased my confidence level.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This is the best and most beautifully designed study-training book I've ever seen
customer_reviews.text: This is the best and most beautifully designed study-training book I've ever seen. Highly recommend. The lessons you learn go beyond the LSAT questions themselves, and can influence the way that you write/argue in everyday life, as well. He's very clear and concise, and you not only learn what you got wrong on practice questions, but *why* you got them wrong, and that's going to make the difference between acing the LSAT and not.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly Thompson

customer_reviews.title: but this book was awesome. It very clearly and simply explains the different ...
customer_reviews.text: Didn't want to write until I actually knew how my score was, but this book was awesome. It very clearly and simply explains the different sections, but differently than others. It doesn't teach you tips and tricks, but rather how to think. You can see your scores improve as you continue throughout the lessons, including the actual LSAT for me. Highly recommend this to anyone trying to self study under a time crunch.
customer_reviews.author: Landon Dial

customer_reviews.title: Great LSAT trainer book that reads much like a novel ...
customer_reviews.text: Great LSAT trainer book that reads much like a novel and stands out from other LSAT preparation books. I have recommended this book to all my friends also pursuing law school applications and the LSAT process. Note i saw a 7 point difference after reading this material.
customer_reviews.author: Morgan S

customer_reviews.title: Buy it, but commit to the book!
customer_reviews.text: A very helpful book. It really helped with understanding some concepts when it comes to taking the LSAT. I did everything in the book and tried studying at least 2-3 hours a day. It genuinely helped me, but you really have to commit. Good luck everyone.!
customer_reviews.author: Stefan S.

customer_reviews.title: This is the book that I used to teach myself ...
customer_reviews.text: This is the book that I used to teach myself how to take the LSAT. I used no other book but this one and a book of practice tests. It took some discipline, but this book was all the coaching I needed!
customer_reviews.author: Emily

customer_reviews.title: Useful for the disciplined student
customer_reviews.text: Using exclusively this book, I was able to go from a 162 diagnostic to a 171 on my first LSAT. I used the 16 week study guide on the Trainer website with an extra 4 weeks tacked on at the end for review and drilling (so about 20 weeks of study total). The strategy this book presents is really great, but I definitely think you need to be disciplined enough to review and reread certain chapters to do well with it.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra Walkin

customer_reviews.title: no real curriculum
customer_reviews.text: the book throws a bunch of concepts at you and doesn't tie them together. Doesn't walk you through answering questions in an effective manner. the explanations for answers don't leave you with a better understanding. the strategies offered in the book never really become useful as once gets to the PT phase. When I took the LSAT it felt like i wasted 6 months with this book
customer_reviews.author: X. Ospina

customer_reviews.title: this book is a must
customer_reviews.text: The best training book I found out of all the others ones i used. This one explains everything step by step just like a live tutor would.
customer_reviews.author: Avalanche17

customer_reviews.title: One major flaw!
customer_reviews.text: Great book so far! But it has one major flaw....there is a bar across each page that didn't print right or something. One line on each page is unreadable! The book is still very useful...but its pretty annoying.
customer_reviews.author: JayMike

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent book. I purchased this book not knowing what to expect. I believe I will do great with this textbook. You do need to purchase the most current 10 actual official lsat prep test with this book.
customer_reviews.author: Elisabeth Boris

customer_reviews.title: Produces results
customer_reviews.text: While you have to be very self motivated and disciplined to get the full effect from this book, it really works when you are. I went front to back on this book in a little over a month after a poor LSAT result. I went from a 156 to a 162 and was even averaging around a 166. Mike Kim really knows his stuff.
customer_reviews.author: Jake

customer_reviews.title: LSAT Trainer was a wonderful self-study method
customer_reviews.text: LSAT Trainer was a wonderful self-study method. I began with a Kaplan book, but did not feel at all confident so I switched to LSAT Trainer. My scores improved (though that is likely also due to having studied the material longer) and my confidence received a huge boost. I don't know my score yet from the actual test but I'm sure it will be much better that it would have without this prep book. I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best LSAT prep!
customer_reviews.text: This book has been so helpful! I did the powerscore bibles before that and kept making the same mistakes over and over again because I didn't really understand the fundamentals behind the questions. This books has helped me improve my understanding tremendously.
customer_reviews.author: Nikolay T.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent place to start when preparing for the LSAT
customer_reviews.text: Mike Kim does an excellent job explaining what to expect on the LSAT and how to prepare for your exam. I can recommend this book to get you started and pointed in the right direction. I will recommend for you to obtain actual official LSAT pretests published by LSAC to complement this book.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel A. Miles

customer_reviews.title: I would not recommend it.
customer_reviews.text: Examples are so horrible that time to time you’d run into two IDENTICAL answers. They’d bear the same weight, I’m not even kidding. Explanations are finicky. Sometimes it felt like author implied: “If you did not get it, go back and read, I’m done explaining!”
customer_reviews.author: SM

customer_reviews.title: The Best LSAT Prep
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased a lot of LSAT prep books, but this by far is the best book I have ever purchased. It takes the PowerScore books and combines them all together. It also allows you to develop a training plan based on your needs. I would purchase this book again.
customer_reviews.author: Kerissa Jenkins

customer_reviews.title: The Best LSAT Training Book on the Market!
customer_reviews.text: This book breaks down the methodology of logic games (yaaay), provides detailed descriptors of reading comprehension questions and much, much more! It truly has helped me understand how to study and what to look for in preparation for the LSAT!!! Well worth the money!”!!!!,!
customer_reviews.author: Clara P. Wahnetah

customer_reviews.title: Poor printing quality- pages stuck together and ripped
customer_reviews.text: The book was great but all the PAGES were STUCK TOGeTHeR. I had to go page by page and unstick then causing them to rip. Poor print quality
customer_reviews.author: lia berman

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: This was a great book, broken out to easily prep for taking the LSAT. I didn’t end up taking the test since I decided taking on that much debt at my age was too much so I cannot comment on the score but this book is great.
customer_reviews.author: Dawn Marie

customer_reviews.title: This bookis by far better than using the Princeton book review
customer_reviews.text: This bookis by far better than using the Princeton book review. I am not taking a prep course. This book was my second go to book at understanding the LSAT. I would recommend this book to anyone who is self-studying. This book in in conjuction with real LSAT prep tests was helpful and I can say I am getting much better at all three areas. The book does not touchin on the writing section at all. But you do learn valuable methods at tackling LG, LR and RC.
customer_reviews.author: Dyan

customer_reviews.title: What a badass!
customer_reviews.text: I wish I could shake this man's hand. This is the best (and frankly most enjoyable) study guide I've ever seem. Mad props, Mike. Brilliant.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best LSAT book on the market
customer_reviews.text: I took a course through Powerscore and a lot of self-study, but this book is the best material I used by far. It completely changes the way you think about the exam. It is directly responsible for increasing my score 5 points (from a decent score to a very competitive score.) If there is one book you buy, this is it.
customer_reviews.author: Alisa

customer_reviews.title: Helpful, alternative study method
customer_reviews.text: I was able to raise my score from a 153 to a 163 in a month. This book was definitely a unique, alternative take on how to study for the LSAT. The drills were helpful and I thought the book provided good explanations on why which answer choices were correct.
customer_reviews.author: Dan J

customer_reviews.title: Remarkable comprehensive study aid
customer_reviews.text: This is a great place to start when studying for the LSAT (and it may be all you need). It gives good thorough advice for each sections and has nicely spaced drills and great explanations.
customer_reviews.author: David Robins

customer_reviews.title: Great book.
customer_reviews.text: Great book! Author is available and helpful for questions too. I loved it. Helped me increase my score by 5 points.
customer_reviews.author: Kara Bloomer

customer_reviews.title: Came in brand-new!
customer_reviews.text: I have heard only good things about The LSAT Trainer, so I finally decided to buy it from a 3rd party vendor since it was a few bucks cheaper. It came in plastic wrapped and brand new, which I am very very happy with! Though I'm only halfway into the book, I am finding it helpful to unlearn certain behaviors I have when taking the LSAT. Here's to hoping this will help me improve my score!
customer_reviews.author: Jin

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic prep book
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic prep book! It has a completely different style than the other brands out there. I highly recommend this book for anyone looking to prep in a innovative way.
customer_reviews.author: G

customer_reviews.title: LSAT Trainer
customer_reviews.text: A great book and worth every dime. Read and study the book and you should do very well on the LSAT.
customer_reviews.author: Happy Shopper23

customer_reviews.title: It's Okay
customer_reviews.text: Not great for breaking my plateau. A test a day allowed me to break 170. I suppose this would be a great book if you are just starting out.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Practical test prep
customer_reviews.text: I bought this book several months before I took the test, and it was very helpful. I read through the tips in here, and then ordered several volumes of actual tests (LSAC puts them out, you can get them on Amazon too) to go through actual questions, and do full, timed practice tests. I highly recommend this book!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Different than the other lsat books
customer_reviews.text: This is a very unique lsat study prep book. His perspective on studying for it is much different than all the other study books I've read. I take my exam Oct 3 and reading his advice on LR makes me feel so much more confident than powerscore's tips.
customer_reviews.author: LP

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Understand and HELPFUL
customer_reviews.text: I used this to study for my second round of the LSAT. I had previously used KAPLAN online and then took a 2 month break before deciding to go for it again. I studied for 6 weeks (I used the 4 and 8 week plans to gauge my schedule set-up) and my score went up by 3 points! I loved the simplicity used in this book. Wish I would have used it before KAPLAN! Much cheaper, so either way it is worth a shot.
customer_reviews.author: mlytle

customer_reviews.title: A LSAT Lifesaver
customer_reviews.text: This book is the best money I spent in while studying for the LSAT. I could not recommend it more; I tell people how great it was just in case they may know someone who is going to take the LSAT. If you are a person who likes to know the why to what you are studying, Mike Kim is the perfect "tutor" for you. While the book is slated as self-paced, do not be turned off by this, as the accompanying website provides schedules, diagrams, insight and tons of help. Thank you, Mike!!
customer_reviews.author: Samantha P.

customer_reviews.title: I liked how he tackled recognising flaws
customer_reviews.text: I liked how he tackled recognising flaws. That's something that I didn't see noted in other textbooks (Powerscore or 7sage). However, I think it was a bit weak in the LG section. Overall a good book with a good overview of the test. Would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Lily

customer_reviews.title: 158-->168 thanks to this book
customer_reviews.text: I completed this book on the 8 week plan and my LSAT score went from 158 on my diagnostic to 168 when I took the test. It was outstanding and worked perfectly with the LSAC sample tests.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Printing error...
customer_reviews.text: Multiple pages of my book were illegible due to what look to be printing errors.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan Bezet

customer_reviews.title: The LSAT simplified
customer_reviews.text: Definitely a different approach to the LSAT, but I’m using this in conjunction with the PowerScore Bibles and I’m liking the balance.
customer_reviews.author: CK Tataw

customer_reviews.title: This works
customer_reviews.text: This worked for me! I passed and got accepted to law school. You must be self-disciplined but I found this to be more practical then attending in-person sessions.
customer_reviews.author: Victoria K.

customer_reviews.title: BUY THIS BOOK
customer_reviews.text: I can not say enough good things about this book. I took an LSAT prep class, paid a lot of money for it, and my score did not increase at all. I bought this book, worked through every single page over the course of a few months, and my LSAT score increased 16 points. This book makes it much easier to understand the material and how to tackle the LSAT. Studying is so much more enjoyable with The LSAT Trainer.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy Glass

customer_reviews.title: Better than powerscore
customer_reviews.text: I thought was better than powerscore bibles, the author is better at explaining things in that it doesn't sound like a robot is trying to teach you
customer_reviews.author: Jamie

customer_reviews.title: Misprinting
customer_reviews.text: The book I received appears to have been misprinted. Some pages are smaller than others, margins are of unequal sizes, and text is not evenly aligned. Printing errors appear to begin around page 100 and continue intermittently (though with enough regularity that they are very distracting) through the end of the book.
customer_reviews.author: Jon Erickson

customer_reviews.title: Helped me significantly
customer_reviews.text: It was very helpful. Helped improve my score. It taught you how to think. I really struggled with the lsat. This book helped way more than my Kaplan Lsat course which I took twice. I highly recommend this book.
customer_reviews.author: Cameron Lesniak

customer_reviews.title: Buy This Book First for the LSAT
customer_reviews.text: A must have book for anyone taking the LSAT. This book should be the first one you read and a staple of your studies. You do not need to take a prep course with this book available and all the resources available online.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Hill

customer_reviews.title: Best LSAT book
customer_reviews.text: I previously used a Princeton Review mini-course and book to study for the LSAT. After a less than ideal score, I retook the LSAT and studied with this book. I improved 10 points. I recommend this book to every considering law school.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Amazing study guide
customer_reviews.text: This book was extremely helpful. If you're a self-motivated person who wants to study on their own schedule, this book is amazing. Can't say enough about it. Just make sure you look up and read the known errors for your version before you go through it - there's a handful of typos that are semi-important.
customer_reviews.author: ValeD

customer_reviews.title: Ugh cut off pages but great book
customer_reviews.text: I really like this book. Had the same problem that I saw another person had. Some of my pages are cut off and out of order. I'm more concerned with the cut off pages. Will not return because I take the LSAT in 2 weeks and don't have time to wait for a new one. Wish I found this book sooner.
customer_reviews.author: shelby

customer_reviews.title: High Quality LSAT Review Material
customer_reviews.text: Easily digestible lessons. I have not taken the test yet, although my practice tests are going well. The author of this text does a great job of explaining the content and giving good advice.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon User

customer_reviews.title: Good book, probably don't buy used.
customer_reviews.text: Good book, great introduction and explanation of LSAT. I bought used-very good condition, major problem, I didn't realize that meant that thered be writing throughout the entire book, on every single problem. So that's ruined. That's on the seller though. And me, the seller and me.
customer_reviews.author: no

customer_reviews.title: Good book and study material
customer_reviews.text: Using it as new material to study for the LSATs and it great.
customer_reviews.author: Sauieh Noushin

customer_reviews.title: Poorly finished book
customer_reviews.text: For some reason this book came poorly finished with a few knicks and uncut edges and covered in blue ink which is now everywhere.
customer_reviews.author: Mathew Brown

customer_reviews.title: ... the most popular books out there and this is better than the rest
customer_reviews.text: I've gone through many of the most popular books out there and this is better than the rest. It takes a holistic approach on questions, which is less on memorization and parsing apart specific question types and more about developing a specific quick approach to many questions while focusing on their similarities. Cannot recommend more!
customer_reviews.author: Amazonian

customer_reviews.title: awesome!
customer_reviews.text: this is such a good book. while i have yet to take the test, i feel very well prepared. the book is super helpful and truly appears to be for the student. it is written so well and the questions are super helpful/beneficial
customer_reviews.author: anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Well... hopefully this wasn’t important info
customer_reviews.text: Disappointing honestly... I’m only on page 48 thus far. The info so far has been informative but the quality isn’t there.
customer_reviews.author: Victoria

customer_reviews.title: Got me into my school and got me my scholarship.
customer_reviews.text: I had a GPA that was low percentiles on basically every school I wanted to go to. I blind diagnostic tested a 154. After 4-6 hours, 5 days a week for 3ish months going through the entire book, and every available previous LSAT (10 of which I took timed and all of which I reviewed logic games after with 7 Sage on YouTube, I ended up with a 167). I could've gotten higher with better studying practices and more logic games review, but if you are coachable this book will get you to basically where you can possibly be.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler Summers

customer_reviews.title: Buy this book!
customer_reviews.text: A comprehensive, well written and formatted guide. By far the best study book for anything that I've come across
customer_reviews.author: Phoebe Rust

customer_reviews.title: Great study prep
customer_reviews.text: I didn't read the entire book, but this was the only prep I had and scored a 148 on my first try. Only studied for a few hours with this book. Very useful information and tips.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: So far, so good!
customer_reviews.text: Have been studying with this guide for a week and so far I’m very happy with how easy to follow it is. With lots of consistent work, I will beat LSAT and this book will help!
customer_reviews.author: Anna R

customer_reviews.title: Universally Perfect LSAT Study Tool
customer_reviews.text: This is the perfect text for those at the beginning stages of LSAT studying as well as those who have tried other methods only to get disappointing results.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa B

customer_reviews.title: Don't Waste Your Money on Those Other Books!
customer_reviews.text: Better than the LSAT Bible Series and all the other expensive, popular LSAT books I purchased and didn't end up using. This was the only book I actually used to study (along with 10 Actuals for practice) and I scored very well. This book breaks logic games down into a very easily digestible form. Once you learn to do them, it's only a matter of learning to do them quickly (that's where 10 Actuals comes in)! Good luck!
customer_reviews.author: TraceyM

customer_reviews.title: The 2 months I spent in this book was so much better than than the 5 I devoted to Powerscores LR
customer_reviews.text: Revolutionary product! His advice in LR completely changed how I approached attacking the stimulus and question stem. The 2 months I spent in this book was so much better than than the 5 I devoted to Powerscores LR. (Though, I suppose PS gave me some basics which may have made this book easier to learn.) I used Powerscores for LG, so can't comment on the LG section in this book. I went from -7 in LR to -2/-1. Also very excellent strategies and mindsets for Reading Comprehension. Powerscores was severely lacking in this area as well. The book is written in an engaging manner, with subtle humor and excellent organization. You won't regret this purchase. Time well spent.
customer_reviews.author: Chizuk

product_meta.title: The LSAT Trainer: A Remarkable Self-Study Guide For The Self-Driven Student
